BBEX3.A.NPR.USD.CA.AA.A04: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Nepal / USD 1 = NPR ... (buying)
Methodology: Calculated on the basis of month-end rates.

Comment on 1991: On 2 and 4 July 1991, the Nepalese rupee was devalued in two stages. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate; calculated devaluation in brackets): 30 June 1991: USD 1 = NPR 35.30 / 35.50  2 July 1991: USD 1 = NPR 38.00 / 38.20 (-7.1%)  4 July 1991: USD 1 = NPR 42.70 / 42.90 (-11.0%)

Comment on 1992: From 4 March 1992 to 12 February 1993, Nepal had a multiple exchange rate system; for information on how the exchange rates were used, see BBEX3:M:NPR:USD:CA:AA:A01. The average free market rate between March and December 1992, calculated on the basis of month-end exchange rates, was USD 1 = NPR 47.12 / 49.48 (buying/selling).
Comment on 1993: For January 1993, the free market rate was used to calculate the average rate.
